result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlton C. Keith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carlton C. Keith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carlton C. Keith was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $ 350.00 plus all mandatory costs, fees and surcharge to be paid by 11-9-16  or serve 25 consecutive days in the House of Correction.
Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 18 months with the mandatory reinstatement fee.

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 18 months  thereafter.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment. Court stayed the commencment until 12-28-15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlton C. Keith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment order returned by USPS as undeliverable

F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
25 days HOC, consecutive.
DUE & OWING.

Defendant Carlton C. Keith in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment. Court stayed the commencment until 12-28-15. 

Fine of $ 350.00 plus all mandatory  costs, fees and surcharge to be paid by 11-9-16  or serve  25 consecutive  days in the House of Correction.

  Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 18 months with the mandatory reinstatement fee.

AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  18 months  thereafter.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Carlton C. Keith in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT ONE:   Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO :  DISMISSED. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. 
As a condition of bail, court ordered the defendant to install an ignition interlock on his vehicle or any vehicle driven by the defendant FORTHWITH. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlton C. Keith in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-17-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlton C. Keith in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Plea Hearing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlton C. Keith in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlton C. Keith in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlton C. Keith in court PRO SE.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Defendant eligible for public defender representation. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Carlton C. Keith
Current: 2869 West Locust Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 05-01-2015)
Prior: 2869 West Locust Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Carlton C. Keith in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-084

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.
Clerk:  jms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Carlton C. Keith not in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/28/15 @ 1:30 pm
